result.execSummary:
The defendant James Anthony Slaten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($300.00 signature bond) gj
THE COURT WILL consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Defendant James Anthony Slaten in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and the Defendant.

THE COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction (HOC) with credit for 10 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and treatment.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Court waived all costs and surcharges. Defendant is indigent.
*  Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Community service of 25 hours.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  THE COURT SENTENCED THE Defendant to serve 30 DAYS of Condition Time at the House of Correction (HOC). Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work and treatment.  REPORT DATE 01-17-2017 by 05:00 pm (1700 hrs.)

THE COURT WILL consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Sentencing Referral Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  7 Letters/Correspondence
